inquiries.user_provisioning: New users are requested through the HR onboarding workflow. The hiring manager submits a ticket specifying the required system access. IT reviews the role requirements and assigns permissions based on predefined role profiles. Manager approval is captured within the ticketing system.
inquiries.user_deprovisioning: HR sends a daily termination list to IT. User accounts are disabled within 24 hours. For voluntary resignations, managers notify HR who then forwards the removal request to IT.
inquiries.periodic_review: Access reviews are conducted annually. Department managers receive exported user lists and confirm if access remains appropriate. Findings are documented and returned to IT for follow-up.
inquiries.privileged_access: Privileged accounts such as system administrators are assigned only to designated IT staff. No periodic review specific to privileged accounts is performed.

inquiries.change_request_process: All changes must be logged in the Change Management System (CMS). A change request includes description, impact assessment, testing plan, and rollback plan. Changes are categorized as standard, normal, or emergency.
inquiries.approval_process: Normal changes require approval from the change owner and the IT manager. High-risk changes also require business owner approval. Approval is captured in the CMS.
inquiries.testing_process: Developers perform unit testing and attach test evidence to the ticket. User acceptance testing (UAT) is performed by business users for major changes.
inquiries.deployment_process: IT operations deploy changes to production. Developers do not have direct access to production environments. For emergency changes, deployment can occur immediately, but must be retrospectively approved within 3 business days.
inquiries.emergency_changes: Emergency changes bypass some standard approval steps but must still have testing evidence when feasible. These are reviewed monthly during the Change Advisory Board (CAB) meeting.
inquiries.segregation_of_duties: Developers do not have the ability to deploy directly to production. Deployment privileges are restricted to the IT operations team.
